articleinfo.title: XFce 4 Utilities and Scripts
articleinfo.releaseinfo: This manual describes the &app; package, version &appversion;.

sect1.title: Introduction
sect1.para: The &app; package provides a taskbar, a nice about box, a run dialog and several useful scripts that are also used by other XFce 4 components such as the panel and the desktop menu.

sect1.title: Taskbar
sect1.para: The taskbar is either at the top or the bottom of the screen and shows all running programs. The behaviour of the taskbar can be changed from settings manager. Run xfce-setting-show taskbar, or start the settings manager from the panel. In addition to the tasklist, the taskbar also features a simple graphical pager and a notification area (also known as the system tray).

sect1.title: Run Dialog
sect1.para: The run dialog allows the user to launch applications. Applications can be run using a Terminal emulator.

sect1.title: About Dialog

textobject.phrase: Shows the About Dialog displaying the credits page (using the GtkHTML widget).

sect1.para: The About Dialog is used to display various informations about XFce to the user. These are basic information about the XFce 4 desktop and its components, the list of developers and contributers that made up XFce 4 and legal information.

sect1.title: About xfce-utils
sect1.para: &app; was written by Jasper Huijsmans (huysmans@users.sourceforge.net), Olvier Fourdan (fourdan@xfce.org) and Benedikt Meurer (benedikt.meurer@unix-ag.uni-siegen.de). To find more information, please visit the XFce web site.
To report a bug or make a suggestion regarding this application or this manual send an e-mail to the xfce4-de mailing list or use the bug tracking system at the XFce SourceForge project site.
